      public static double getHeadingFromDirection(Vector3d directionVec)
      Returns heading in degrees for the given direction vector.
      Parameters:
      directionVec - Direction vector to get the heading for
      Returns:
      Heading in degrees (0 = north, 90 = east, 180 = south, 270 = west)

      Parameters:

      result - Vector3d to store the result in
      Returns:
      result Vector3d

    • doesXZIntersect

      public static boolean doesXZIntersect(Vector3d a1, Vector3d b1, Vector3d a2, Vector3d b2)
      Function to check if two line segments (a1, b1) and (a2, b2) intersect.
      Parameters:
      a1 - First point of first line segment
      b1 - Second point of first line segment
      a2 - First point of second line segment
      b2 - Second point of second line segment
      Returns:
      true if the two line segments intersect, else false

    • computeXZLineIntersectionPoint

      public static boolean computeXZLineIntersectionPoint(Vector3d e11, Vector3d e12, Vector3d e21, Vector3d e22, Vector3d result)
      Returns the intersection point of two lines in the XZ plane. Notice that, although 3D coordinates are used, only the X and Z components are considered. The Y component of the returned intersection point is always 0. The function considers lines of infinite length; hence the intersection point does not necessarily lie between e11, e12 and e21, e22. If the specified edges are parallel false is returned.
      Parameters:
      e11 - First point of first line
      e12 - Second point of first line
      e21 - First point of second line
      e22 - Second point of second line
      result - Is set to the intersection point of the two lines (of infinite length) specified by the given points. If the lines are parallel result remains unchanged
      Returns:
      true if a intersection point was found, false if lines are parallel

    • computeXZEdgeIntersectionPoint

      public static boolean computeXZEdgeIntersectionPoint(Vector3d e11, Vector3d e12, Vector3d e21, Vector3d e22, Vector3d result)
      Similar to computeXZLineIntersectionPoint(Vector3d, Vector3d, Vector3d, Vector3d, Vector3d) but also checks if the resulting intersection point lies between e11, e12 and e21, e22. Returns false if the edges are parallel or the intersection point lies outside the edge borders.
      Parameters:
      e11 - First point of first edge
      e12 - Second point of first edge
      e21 - First point of second edge
      e22 - Second point of second edge
      result - Is set to the intersection point of the two edges (of infinite length) specified by the given points. If the edges do not intersect the result is undefined
      Returns:
      true if a intersection point was found

    • curvature

      public static double curvature(Vector3d vecA, Vector3d vecB, Vector3d vecC)
